intro: Calyptrogyne sarapiquensis, commonly known as the Sarapiquí calyptrogyne, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a rough texture, while its fruit is a capsule that disperses seeds by wind. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats within lowland rainforests.
